I‚Äôm currently working on the Zurich:50 dataset and have encountered issues with four specific questions (refer to the attached images). No matter what logic or approach I use to solve these four questions, the system consistently displays the response as ‚ÄúIncorrect answer‚Äù. However, all other questions in the same dataset are accepting my answers and showing as ‚ÄúCorrect answer‚Äù.

I‚Äôve tried multiple approaches and ensured that the calculations are correct, but I still receive an incorrect response. Could someone kindly assist in identifying if there‚Äôs a possible issue with these specific questions or suggest any alternative approach that might work?

Thank you in advance for your help!

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
A few pointers (looking at some of the other threads and the description on the portal). Pls see if they help:
(a) booleans true and false (lowercase). This has been mentioned in the project description in the portal. Since you mentioned: Hireable - True 64, Total following 4923, Average 76.922, is that a capital ‚ÄòT‚Äô in True? Pls check if the booleans have been correctly saved in the csvs (both users and repositories csv). Verify there are no uppercase True or False booleans anywhere in the two files.
(b) Assuming booleans are correctly saved in both the csvs, double check if the two csvs are (a) committed and (b) in the main branch. But, that should be the case anyways, because the errors you see are only for specific questions.
(c) If you‚Äôve updated the csv files in main, do a hard browser refresh. Several threads have mentioned that as a solution for other questions.

posts.name: Bhavin
posts.cooked:
For all the questions dependent on boolean values, please ensure that you are following the instructions as mentioned in the quiz.
Refer below reference,

Project 1 doubt regarding question Tools in Data Science
Check your csv files have boolean values represented as true instead of TRUE\True and false instead of FALSE\False. The correct answers seem be calculated from our files in Github only (Assumably because of the dynamic nature of the data) so we need to follow the instructions exactly as given in the quiz. I was able to get these answers corrected after I reuploaded the csv files with these changes, barring #13.
